title: Malt Production Performance Optimization
subtitle: Leveraging 13 years of historical data for production yield and quality optimization

sections.overview: I developed a **production optimization framework** for a malt manufacturing plant by analyzing 13 years of historical operational data. The challenge was to identify which of many **process parameters** most significantly influenced **production yield** and **quality outcomes**. To address this, I applied **advanced statistical methods**—including correlation analysis and hypothesis testing—to evaluate the complex relationships between variables. This analysis successfully bridged the gap between technical process control and commercial strategy, providing actionable insights for **process improvement** and **data-driven pricing** decisions.
businessValue: Operationally: Pinpoints parameters influencing yield and quality to guide process optimization
Commercially: Quantifies cost impact of client-requested parameter adjustments for fair pricing
Strategic Integration: Connects technical process control with customer-facing teams
keyResults: Processed **13 years** of data with over **52 variables** evaluated
Built statistically significant correlation matrices for **critical parameters** (Efdm, PT, Fil T, etc.)
Identified directional recommendations (↑/↓) for performance improvement
Quantified potential improvements in **yield and energy efficiency**
benefits: Targeted actions to reduce energy use and material waste
Evidence-based cost quantification for contract pricing support
Early detection of deviations from optimal quality parameter ranges
Research support for adapting recipes to different barley harvests
